title: Initial Launch of Skill w/At Bat Premium Subscription
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND user has enabled the MLB Skill
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
custom_steps:
WHEN the user invokes Alexa and speaks the intent to launch the skill for the first time:
i.e.
'Launch MLB'
'Open MLB'
'Start MLB'
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with:
"Welcome to M.L.B. What team would you like to listen to?"
AND user is able to speak their intent

title: EDIT Initial Launch of Skill w/No At Bat subscription
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND user has enabled the MLB Skill
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with NO At Bat premium paid subscription
custom_steps:
WHEN the user invokes Alexa and speaks the intent to launch the skill for the first time:
i.e.
'Launch MLB'
'Open MLB'
'Start MLB'
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with:
"To use the MLB skill, you'll first need to link your M.L.B.com account. You must have a subscription to At Bat premium or MLB.tv Premium. I've sent some info to the Alexa app to get you started."
AND in the app the user it taken to the account linking card, and be directed to an At Bat purchase flow

title: EDIT Initial Launch of Skill, no User Intent
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND user has enabled the MLB Skill
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND the user invokes Alexa and calls out the the skill 'Launch MLB' for the first time
AND Alexa responds with: Welcome to M.L.B. What team would you like to listen to?
custom_steps: WHEN the user does not speaks an intent
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds again with:
The MLB skill can play audio broadcasts for live MLB games. While listening to games, you can pause and resume live playback at any time. Try saying things like, “Play the Mets game,” “I want to listen to the Royals,” or “pause the game.” What would you like to do?"
AND user is able to speak their intent

THIS RESPONSE does not occur every single time. Only got it to occur once during subsequent launches.

title: Subsequent Lauch of MLB skill, User has NO At Bat subscription
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND user has enabled the MLB Skill
AND account is linked to a MLB.com account with NO At Bat premium paid subscription
custom_steps:
WHEN the user invokes Alexa and states the intent to launch MLB:
i.e.
'Launch MLB'
'Open MLB'
'Start MLB'
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa prompts the the user to link the account: To use the MLB skill, you'll first need to link your M.L.B.com account. You must have a subscription to At Bat premium or MLB.tv Premium. I've sent some info to the Alexa app to get you started.
AND in the client app, the user is taken to the account linking card, and is directed to an At Bat purchase flow

title: Subsequent Launch of MLB skill, User has At Bat Premium paid subscription
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND user has enabled the MLB Skill
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
custom_steps:
WHEN the user invokes Alexa and invokes the skill to launch MLB:
i.e.
'Launch MLB'
'Open MLB'
'Start MLB'
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with:
"Welcome to M.L.B. What team would you like to listen to?"
AND user is able to speak their intent

title: Subsequent Launch of MLB skill w/no intent, User has At Bat Premium paid subscription
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND user has enabled the MLB Skill
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND the user invokes Alexa with the intent to launch skill: i.e. 'Launch MLB'
AND Alexa responds with: Welcome to M.L.B. What team would you like to listen to?
custom_steps: WHEN the user does not speak any intents
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with:
The MLB skill can play audio broadcasts for live MLB games. While listening to games, you can pause and resume live playback at any time. Try saying things like, “Play the Mets game,” “I want to listen to the Royals,” or “pause the game.” What would you like to do?"

AND user is able to speak their intent

title: Launch of MLB skill, Account Not Linked
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND user has enabled the MLB Skill
AND account is NOT linked to any MLB.com account
custom_steps: WHEN the user invokes Alexa with the intent to launch skill: i.e. 'Launch MLB'
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with:
To use the MLB skill, you'll first need to link your M.L.B.com account. You must have a subscription to At Bat premium or MLB.tv Premium. I've sent some info to the Alexa app to get you started."

title: User Abandons At Bat purchase Flow, Requests Game
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND user has enabled the MLB Skill
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with NO At Bat premium paid subscription
AND user navigates to the At Bat purchase flow
custom_steps:
WHEN the user abandons purchase flow page without purchasing
AND the user speaks a game request intent: i.e. "Ask M.L.B. to play the [team name, nickname, or locale]."
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with the account linking message: 
"To use the MLB skill, you'll first need to link your M.L.B.com account. I've sent some info to the Alexa app to get you started."
AND the user can tap on account linking card, and be directed to an At Bat purchase webview.

title: User has changed At Bat password since initial linking, Requests Game
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND user has enabled the MLB Skill
AND account is linked to a MLB.com account w/o At Bat premium subscription
custom_steps:
WHEN the user logs into their MLB.com account (either on web or mobile, test both)
AND updates the password
AND the user speaks a game request intent
i.e.
User - "Alexa Open MLB.
Alexa - "Welcome to MLB. What team would you like to listen to?"
User - responds with [team name, nickname, or locale]"
custom_expected:
THEN the expected behavior is treating the user as if they were not linked
AND Alexa responds with "To use the skill, you first need to link your MLB.com account. I've sent some info to the Alexa app to get you started."
AND the app sends the linking card

title: User has changed At Bat password, logs in w/New Password
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND user has enabled the MLB Skill
AND account is linked to a MLB.com account
AND the user has changed the MLB.com password (either on web or mobile, test both)
custom_steps:
WHEN the user disables the skill
AND the user enables the skill again
AND the user attempts to links the account
custom_expected:
THEN the user is taken to the login page
AND is able to login with the new password

title: User has changed At Bat password, Disables & Enables Skill, Requests Game
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND user has enabled the MLB Skill
AND account is linked to a MLB.com
AND the user has changed the MLB.com password (either on web or mobile, test both)
custom_steps:
WHEN the user disables the skill
AND the user enables the skill again
AND the user speaks a game request intent:
i.e. "Alexa Open MLB.
custom_expected:
THEN the user is prompted by Alexa to enable the skill: "To use the skill, you'll first need to link your MLB.com. I've sent some some info to the Alexa app to get you started."
AND the app sends the user to the login/registration page
AND the user is able to link the account using the new password

title: Request Live Game, User has expired/unentitled At Bat Premium paid subscription
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND user has enabled the MLB Skill
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with active At Bat premium paid subscription
AND user has linked the accounts
custom_steps:
WHEN the subscription expires
OR the user manually removes entitlement from user account
AND the user speaks game request intent of a Live / In Progress game: i.e. "Ask M.L.B. to play the [team name, nickname, or locale]."
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with: "Sorry, there was a problem with your M.L.B. account or subscription."
AND the user hears the account linking message
AND can tap on account linking card
AND and be directed to an At Bat purchase webview.

title: Team/Nickname/Locale, User has MLB.com account w/o access to Gameday Audio
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND user has enabled the MLB Skill
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with NO At Bat account w/ (NO ACCESS TO AUDIO)
custom_steps: WHEN the user invokes Alexa with a valid Team, Nickname, or Locale
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with a:
"To use the skill, you'll first need to link your MLB.com account. I've sent some info to the Alexa app to get you started"
AND in the Alexa app user attempts to link the account
AND user is taken to the Purchase page which takes user to the At Bat purchase flow

title: Switch from Account w/At Bat Premium subscription to Account without At Bat
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND user has enabled the MLB Skill
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND the user logs out
custom_steps:
WHEN the user logs in to Alexa (user is prompted to go through device setup flow again)
AND the user enables the MLB Skill
AND links to an account w/o At Bat subscription
AND the user invokes Alexa for a gameday audio media request
custom_expected:
THEN the user is not able to access gameday audio
AND Alexa provides a No Gameday Authoriz. Response: "To use the MLB skill, you'll first need to link your M.L.B.com account. You must have a subscription to At Bat premium or MLB.tv Premium. I've sent some info to the Alexa app to get you started."
AND in the Alexa app the user is given the option to taps the linking card for the At Bat purchase flow

title: Switch from Account Without At Bat to Account w/At Bat Premium subscription
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND user has enabled the MLB Skill
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with NO At Bat premium paid subscription
AND the user logs out
custom_steps:
WHEN the user logs in & links to an account with At Bat premium subscription (user is prompted to go through setup flow again)
AND the user invokes Alexa for a gameday audio media request
custom_expected:
THEN the user is given the game status
AND able to access gameday audio broadcast if available

title: Relink to MLB.com account
custom_preconds:
*Currently, the authentication Webview sets a cookie, that the Alexa client app respects after the user un-links

GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND user has enabled the MLB Skill
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND the user disables the skill & unlinks the account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user enables the MLB skill again
and attempts to link accounts
custom_expected:
THEN it links to the same MLB.com account as before
AND user get confirmation page that the account is linked

title: Relink to Another/New MLB.com account
custom_preconds:
*Currently, the authentication Webview sets a cookie, that the Alexa client app respects after the user unlinks. The only way to wipe this cookie is to delete and reinstall the Alexa app.

GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND user has enabled the MLB Skill
AND account is linked to a MLB.com account
AND the user disables the skill & unlinks the account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user logs out, logs in, enables the MLB skill again
OR
WHEN the user deletes and reinstalls the Alexa app, logs in, enables the MLB skill

AND attempts to link to another/new MLB.com account
custom_expected:
THEN
- if MLB.com account is At Bat Premium subscription, it links to the new MLB.com account & user get confirmation page that the account is linked
- if MLB.com account does not have At Bat Premium subscription, user is taken to the At Bat Premium Purchase Page

title: Account w/Multiple Adults in Amazon Househould
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has a main Amazon account
AND the user has another adult added to their main Amazon Household account (via Amazon.com)
AND user has accepted the Amazon terms & conditions
AND via the Alexa App, the user has enabled the MLB skill
AND the user opens the MLB skill
custom_steps:
When the user invokes Alexa from their main amazon account to 
switches accounts: i.e. "Alexa, Switch Accounts"
OR
asks which profile it is: i.e. "Alexa, Which profile is this?"
AND the user is in the added household member's profile/account
AND that user makes an intent to access the MLB skill or gameday audio broadcast
custom_expected: THEN there is no expectation of allowing household members to share access to the skill.

title: Seemingly Linked Account Provides Error
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND user has enabled the MLB Skill
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
custom_steps:
WHEN the user's accounts seemed linked in the system
AND sees a failure due to authentication or authorization in media framework
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with a:
"Sorry, there was a problem with your M.L.B. account or subscription. I've sent some info to the Alexa app to help you."
AND user is sent to linking card in the Alexa app

title: EDIT Team/Nickname/Locale, User ID Token is Invalid
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND user has enabled the MLB Skill
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with NO At Bat premium paid subscription

Questions:
1. For the expected results, is the only scenario where the user has to reauthorize that they signed in with a non-paid subscription account?
2. What occurs if the user is signed out accidently at this point or loses connection?
custom_steps: WHEN there is a currently a live broadcast for the team name, nickname, or local and the user request the feed
custom_expected:
THEN the user is provided with a Login Problem Response
AND taken to the MLB Login page on the Alexa app
AND taken to the MLB Login form to re-authorize

title: DELETE?_Switch from Account w/At Bat Premium subscription to Account without At Bat, MLB Skill Not Enabled
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND has linked the account to an MLB.com At Bat Premium paid subscription
AND the user logs out
custom_steps:
WHEN the user logs in (user is prompted to go through the device setup flow again)
AND links to an account w/o At Bat subscription
AND the user invokes Alexa for a gameday audio media request
custom_expected:
THEN the user is prompted by Alexa with an enable MLB Skill: If you've already enabled MLB say "Open MLB". Otherwise, first say, "Enable MLB skill."
AND in the Alexa app the user is given the option to Enable the skill

title: Sign Out_SDBB-182?????
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed into & setup the client app, Alexa
AND user has enabled the MLB Skill
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
custom_steps: When the user signs out from the app
